projects.title: Databyss
body: I am the co-founder and tech lead for Databyss, a writing app that combines the power of a graph database with the usability of a word processor. Databyss is also a 501(c)(3) charitable organization with a mission to build tools and systems that are freely available to researchers, students, and educators.

projects.title: AR Magic Lantern
body: As part of the research for my master's thesis, I designed and built the next generation of a Spatial AR (SAR) device developed by the Full-body Interaction Lab at Universitat Pompeu Fabra. The 'AR Magic Lantern' is a handheld smart projector that tracks its own location and orientation so it can place situated digital content onto any surface in the environment.

After presenting the thesis, I continued as the tech lead for the prototype, which is intended for deployment in museums, cultural heritage sites, and other hands-on educational contexts. We are formalizing the elements of the Unity application into a game engine that is specialized for these contexts, making it easier for game designers, experience designers and curators to prototype and deploy interactive AR content.

projects.title: Chem101 Dimensional Analysis
body: Chem101 is a popular chemistry classroom app for mobile and web. For this contract, I built the Dimensional Analysis module, an interactive mini-app that teaches balanced equations through an intuitive touch and drop interface.

projects.title: Skilltype
body: Tony Zanders had a vision and a Wordpress prototype for a talent marketplace built especially for information professionals. I led the implementation of the front end of what would become Skilltype.com. From the start, we focused on responsive, accessible components. With the working MVP I delivered, Skilltype was able to start signing up users and building their community.

projects.title: In Your Land
info: Glyndoor Gallery, Wave Hill Public Gardens
body: Jeff Mertz is a photographer and filmmaker. Over the course of three seasons, Jeff filmed birds in the greater New York City area. The footage, along with an original score, became a two-channel video installation for the New York Audubon Society's artist-in-residence program on Govenor's Island during the summer of 2017.

For the installation's appearance in the Glyndoor Gallery at Wave Hill, I built an interactive iPad app that adds an exploratory component to the experience, as well as the software that synchs the video streams with the content in the apps.
The web version of the film and iPhone/Android companion apps are in progress.

projects.title: Tennis Portraits with Watson
body: Ogilvy had developed a photobooth kiosk application for IBM that uses the Watson Tone Analyzer API to generate an “emoji portrait” of the user based on their responses to a set of personality questions.
I was tasked with adapting the Javascript codebase for photobooths at the US Open as well as building a play-at-home version for web and mobile web.

projects.title: Try Your Hand at Quantum
body: IBM built the world’s first web API for a quantum computer and asked Ogilvy to develop a page that showcased this new technology.

I developed a page to demonstrate the capabilities of the new technology. The demo uses the classic shell game Four Card Monte to illustrate the quantum computer’s ability to find a queen in a set of four cards on the first try, whereas a conventional computer requires up to 4 tries.

projects.title: Watson Health Activation
body: IBM wanted to show off the ways that Watson was empowering healthcare professionals with a set of kiosks at the HIMSS (Health Information & Management Systems Society) conference.
I built an interactive video experience that was deployed on nine screens throughout the conference, each with its own  content and chapter navigation.

projects.title: IKEA 404 Puzzle Prototype
body: The creative team at Ogilvy noticed that the IKEA 404 page was very minimal and serious, so I worked with them to prototype a puzzle app that would liven up the page.
The result was a game inspired by the Chinese tangram game in which the player must rearrange unassembled IKEA furniture (or broken plates, in this example) into fun shapes.

projects.title: "Good Start New Look"
body: When Gerber redesigned the labels for their Good Start line of formula, they wanted to spread the word and help customers learn more about the new labels.
I built a microsoite that users reached through social media, email and a YouTube campaign.

projects.title: Teletask iOS App
body: Teletask is a web-based notification and messenger service that specializes in serving healthcare and institutional organizations.
I built an iOS application in React Native that adds access to many of the service’s features in a rich native app. The Android version is currently in the works.
